trans-unit.source: Use the <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_SET_DATABASE_PROPERTY</codeph> system procedure to set or delete the value of a property of the database on the current connection.

seg-source.mrk: Use the <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_SET_DATABASE_PROPERTY</codeph> system procedure to set or delete the value of a property of the database on the current connection.

target.mrk: Use the <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_SET_DATABASE_PROPERTY</codeph> system procedure to set or delete the value of a property of the database on the current connection.

trans-unit.source: SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_SET_DATABASE_PROPERTY(IN KEY VARCHAR(128), IN VALUE VARCHAR(32672))

seg-source.mrk: SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_SET_DATABASE_PROPERTY(IN KEY VARCHAR(128), IN VALUE VARCHAR(32672))

target.mrk: SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_SET_DATABASE_PROPERTY(IN KEY VARCHAR(128), IN VALUE VARCHAR(32672))

trans-unit.source: This procedure does not return any results.

seg-source.mrk: This procedure does not return any results.

target.mrk: This procedure does not return any results.

trans-unit.source: If VALUE is not null, then the property with key value KEY is set to VALUE. If VALUE is null, then the property with key value KEY is deleted from the database property set.

seg-source.mrk: If VALUE is not null, then the property with key value KEY is set to VALUE.
If VALUE is null, then the property with key value KEY is deleted from the database property set.

target.mrk: If VALUE is not null, then the property with key value KEY is set to VALUE.
If VALUE is null, then the property with key value KEY is deleted from the database property set.

trans-unit.source: If VALUE is an invalid value for the property, <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> uses the default value of the property, although <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_SET_DATABASE_PROPERTY</codeph> sets the invalid value.

seg-source.mrk: If VALUE is an invalid value for the property, <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> uses the default value of the property, although <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_SET_DATABASE_PROPERTY</codeph> sets the invalid value.

target.mrk: If VALUE is an invalid value for the property, <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> uses the default value of the property, although <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_SET_DATABASE_PROPERTY</codeph> sets the invalid value.

trans-unit.source: If authentication and SQL authorization are both enabled, only the <xref href="rrefattrib26867.dita#rrefattrib26867">database owner</xref> has execute privileges on this procedure by default. See "Enabling user authentication" and "Setting the SQL standard authorization mode" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph> for more information. The database owner can grant access to other users.

trans-unit.source: Set the <codeph><xref href="rrefproper10607.dita#rrefproper10607">derby.locks.deadlockTimeout</xref></codeph> property to a value of 10:

seg-source.mrk: Set the <codeph><xref href="rrefproper10607.dita#rrefproper10607">derby.locks.deadlockTimeout</xref></codeph> property to a value of 10:

target.mrk: Set the <codeph><xref href="rrefproper10607.dita#rrefproper10607">derby.locks.deadlockTimeout</xref></codeph> property to a value of 10:

trans-unit.source: CallableStatement cs = conn.prepareCall ("CALL SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_SET_DATABASE_PROPERTY(?, ?)"); cs.setString(1, "derby.locks.deadlockTimeout"); cs.setString(2, "10"); cs.execute(); cs.close();

seg-source.mrk: CallableStatement cs = conn.prepareCall ("CALL SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_SET_DATABASE_PROPERTY(?, ?)"); cs.setString(1, "derby.locks.deadlockTimeout"); cs.setString(2, "10"); cs.execute(); cs.close();

target.mrk: CallableStatement cs = conn.prepareCall ("CALL SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_SET_DATABASE_PROPERTY(?, ?)"); cs.setString(1, "derby.locks.deadlockTimeout"); cs.setString(2, "10"); cs.execute(); cs.close();
